intro: Galium sylvestre var. bocconei, commonly known as Boccone's wood-sorrel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers, typically in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and often sought-after species in horticulture and ecological studies.
